title: Bug 6009 - New class wizard doesn't get context right for nested classes
description: When using the new class wizard, the context for nested classes is not being determined correctly.
OB: When using the new class wizard, if a .java file is open in the editor and the 'Enclosing Type' checkbox is selected, the 'Enclosing Type' field is blank instead of defaulting to the current type in the editor.
EB: When using the new class wizard, if a .java file is open in the editor and the 'Enclosing Type' checkbox is selected, the 'Enclosing Type' field should default to the current type in the editor.
SR:
1. Open a .java file in the editor.
2. Click on the new class button.
3. Check the 'Enclosing Type' checkbox.
4. Verify that the 'Enclosing Type' field is blank instead of defaulting to the current type in the editor.
